Package clientGUIControllers

Class RegisteredCustomerController

java.lang.Object
clientGUIControllers.RegisteredCustomerController
public class RegisteredCustomerController extends Object
This class is used to handle the RegisteredCustomer's GUI screen. It allows the registered customer to make an order, view catalog, manage his orders and pick up an order. It handles the actions performed by the registered customer. The class has several methods that handle the different button presses on the RegisteredCustomer screen, such as the logOutPressed, manageMyOrderPressed, pickUpMyOrderPressed,viewCatalogPressed and makeAnOrderPressed methods.

    • RegisteredCustomerController

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      The initialize method is called when the fxml file is loaded. It initializes the pickUpMyOrderBtn and pickupPhoto as invisible, sets the customer variable to the current user, sets the welcome back label text, disables the make an order button if the user's status is not Active, sets the pickUpMyOrderBtn and pickupPhoto as visible if the client configuration is not "OL", and sets the back button as visible if the user's role is not RegisteredCustomer.

    • backPressed

      void backPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method handles the action event when the back button is pressed. It calls the backOrNextPressed(ActionEvent, String) method with the event and the appropriate screen according to the current user's role.
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggered this method, in this case the back button being pressed.

    • xPressed

      void xPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggered the action. This method is triggered when the user presses the 'X' button. It calls the xPressed method from the CommonActionsController class. This method is responsible for closing the current window.

    • logOutPressed

      void logOutPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the logout button press event. It calls the logOutPressed method in the CommonActionsController class.
      Parameters:
      event - the logout button press event

    • infoBtn_Pressed

      void infoBtn_Pressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      A button when clicked it displays information about the user. Another click will hide the information
      Parameters:
      event -

    • manageMyOrderPressed

      void manageMyOrderPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is used to handle the event when the user clicks on the 'Manage My Order' button. It navigates the user to the 'ManageMyOrderScreen.fxml' screen. 'ManageMyOrderScreen.fxml' screen the user can view his order history and confirm receipt of deliveries.
      Parameters:
      event - ActionEvent - The event that triggers this method.

    • pickUpMyOrderPressed

      void pickUpMyOrderPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method handles the event when the "pickUpMyOrderBtn" button is pressed. It navigates the user to the "PickUpOrderScreen.fxml" screen, which allows the user to pick up their order.
      Parameters:
      event - the event of pressing the "pickUpMyOrderBtn" button.

    • viewCatalogPressed

      void viewCatalogPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The method handles the event of pressing the view catalog button. It calls the backOrNextPressed(ActionEvent, String)} method from the CommonActionsController class, the user will be transferred to the view catalog screen to see the all products.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of pressing the view catalog button.

    • makeAnOrderPressed

      void makeAnOrderPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is executed when the "Make an Order" button is pressed. It checks the current configuration of the client console and either navigates to the Remote Order Screen for remote order(OLbconfiguration) or the My Order Screen for local order(EK configuration).
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent that triggered this method.

    • wantToBeSubscriberPressed

      void wantToBeSubscriberPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The wantToBeSubscriberPressed method is called when the wantToBeSubscriberBtn is pressed. It opens a pop-up window with the title "Subscriber registration request", displaying a message asking the user to contact a service representative at the provided number to register as a subscriber.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that triggers the method.

    • setUserInformation

      private void setUserInformation()
